result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A. Mork was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $200.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle A. Mork

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 15CM-88 and 15CM-218 - Both Cases Called @ 11:40 AM: Defendant Kyle A. Mork in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by ADA. Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CM-88 Plea (No DL 2):  NC  15CM-218 Plea Ct 2 (BJump):  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC as to both matters.  15CM-218 Ct 1 and 15TR-1508 both DRI.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Will accept Joint recommendation of counsel - 15CM-88:  Court Costs Only plus DNA Surcharge - $200 Cash Bond to apply - 60 DTP or PP.  15CM-218 - 60 days I/S (Huber, GT and 17 days TS Credit) -  S/W - 1 yr probation.  COnditions:  All terms and conditions as determined by supervising agent and Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge and Def must provide DNA Sample by the end of the day today.  Expungement process of DNA record explained to Def thru DOJ.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Kyle A. Mork in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE is working toward obtaining a valid DL.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle A. Mork
Current: 638 W Main St, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 04-22-2015)
Prior: W8432 Nakoma Ave, Wautoma, WI 54982
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:30 PM: Defendant Kyle A. Mork in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - employment and earnings discussed.  Def requests to speak with the State prior to deciding on counsel issue.  Off Record for Def to speak with ADA on resolution.  Back of Record at 3:33 PM:  Per ADA:  Def wishes to try and obtain valid DL.  Def also given SPD contact information.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 09:15 am.
